intro: Marcgravia cordachida, commonly known as the velvetleaf mombasa. It is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae, native to tropical regions of Africa. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are velvety to the touch. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Marcgravia cordachida is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along riverbanks.
